page.title: 04 A Disaster
page.content: The biggest explosion in Britain happened in Fauld just after 11.00am on Monday morning 27th November 1944. It was caused by thousands of pounds of bombs blowing up which were stored in old mine workings.They were detonated by accident.The Crater is 90ft deep and 500 yards across.It covers 12 acres. It is dotted with big chunks of gypsum that have been thrown out very easily like small stones.There was once a 185 acre farm which is now a big hole in the countryside.Boulders crashed down and one 30-ton rock was found half a mile away.69 people were killed including 6 Italians,19 bodies were never found.Damage was done to buildings all around.The Memorial Hall was built in memory of the people who were killed.If you go to the site now you will see bushes,ponds, wildlife and some rare flowers.
